name: YanFiona
content:

H3: Contact

H3: Recruitment
H2: Three projects are recruiting postdoc researchers, PhD
                            students, research associates, and research assistants.
• Medical Speech Interaction System: 1 postdoc researcher, 1 research
                                    associate, 2-3 research assistants(details)
• Computer Music: 1-2 postdoc researchers, 1-2 PhD students, 1
                                    research associate(details)
• EEG Analysis: 2-3 postdoc researchers, 2-3 PhD students, 1 research assistant(details)

name: YanFiona
content:
H2: If you are interested, please emailyan.liu@polyu.edu.hkbefore Nov. 30, 2024.
• Use a subject line format: Application for [POSITION] from [YOUR
                                    NAME]. Example: Application for PhD Student in EEG Data Analysis from John Smith.
• Attach your Resume and related documents, including GPA/ranking,
                                    TOEFL/IELTS scores (only for PhD applications), Publications/research experience,
                                    and Awards.

name: YanFiona
content:
H3: Research Interests
H3: Research Group of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics
The research group of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics
                    brings
                    together the collective efforts from diverse areas of expertise to deliver high impact research.
                    Starting from the research foundations of learning theory and control theory, our group has 9 group
                    members and works on various kinds of machine learning models, such as deep learning and transfer
                    learning models, and applies these in the design of robots. Moreover, our group works on social
                    robotics, affective computing, and artificial creativity as well.

name: YanFiona
content:
H3: Cognitive Computing Lab
Cognitive computing includes theoretical study, real world
                    problem
                    solving, and system implementation that arise from, relate to, or deliberately influence human’s
                    cognition system and procedure. Cognitive computing has two complementary faces: Discover the
                    secrets of human brain by exploring information technologies; Investigate novel computational models
                    and systems by referencing brain structure and mind process.
